alert.note: Alert for Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:31PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Sterling and far northwestern Tom Green Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 727 PM CDT, radar showed a cluster of strong thunderstorms just southwest of Sterling City, and moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gust to 45 mph, frequent lightning, and pea size hail. Heavy rain in a short period of time could cause ponding of water on roads. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain could sharply reduce visibility for motorists. Locations impacted include... Sterling City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
